article_title: Book Review: 'Redeeming the Dream' by David Boies and Theodore B. Olson and 'Forcing the Spring' by Jo Becker
article_text: In the United States, the public debate over same-sex marriage goes back at least as far as 1970, when two male students at the University of Minnesota attempted to obtain a marriage license. In 1974, PBS aired a groundbreaking debate on the subject featuring Frank Kameny, the first person to legally challenge his firing from a government job due to sexual orientation. In 1993, the Hawaii Supreme Court became the first in the country to declare that denying marriage certificates to same-sex couples violated a state...

article_summary:
In 1993, the Hawaii Supreme Court became the first in the country to declare that denying marriage certificates to same-sex couples violated a state...
In the United States, the public debate over same-sex marriage goes back at least as far as 1970, when two male students at the University of Minnesota attempted to obtain a marriage license.
In 1974, PBS aired a groundbreaking debate on the subject featuring Frank Kameny, the first person to legally challenge his firing from a government job due to sexual orientation.
